contentrichtext.text: {{For|the bishop|John II, Bishop of Jerusalem}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''John II of Jerusalem''' (1259 or ca. 1267 – [[Nicosia]], 20 May 1285) was the eldest son of [[Hugh III of Cyprus]] and Isabella of Ibelin. He succeeded his father as [[Kingdom of Cyprus|King of Cyprus]] (as '''John I''') on March 24 and was crowned at [[Selimiye Mosque (Nicosia)|Santa Sophia]], [[Nicosia]] on May 11, 1284. His succession as [[Kingdom of Jerusalem|King of Jerusalem]] was opposed by [[Charles I of Naples|Charles of Anjou]], who had also disrupted his father's succession. John died the following year on 20 May, having never married and leaving no children. He was buried in the church of [[St. Demetrius]] or according to some [[Selimiye Mosque (Nicosia)|Santa Sophia]], in [[Nicosia]]. According to some authors he was poisoned by his brothers, one of whom, [[Henry II of Cyprus|Henry II]], succeeded him in Cyprus and [[Jerusalem]]. He died unmarried and without issue. {{S-start}} {{S-bef| rows = 2 | before = [[Hugh III of Cyprus|Hugh III/I]] }} {{S-ttl| title = [[Kingdom of Cyprus|King of Cyprus]] | years = 1284–1285 }} {{S-aft| rows = 2 | after = [[Henry II of Jerusalem|Henry II]] }} {{S-ttl| title = [[Kings of Jerusalem|King of Jerusalem]] | years = 1284–1285 }} {{S-end}} {{Jerusalem Monarchs}} {{Cypriot Monarchs}} {{Persondata | name = John II of Jerusalem | alternative names = | short description = King of Cyprus and Jerusalem | date of birth = 1259 | place of birth = | date of death = 1285 | place of death = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:John 02 Of Jerusalem}} [[Category:Roman Catholic monarchs]] [[Category:1259 births]] [[Category:1285 deaths]] [[Category:Kings of Jerusalem]] [[Category:Kings of Cyprus|John I of Cyprus]]
